info.title: Twinfield OpenID Connect / OAuth 2.0
info.description:
OpenID Connect identity layer and OAuth 2.0 authentication for Twinfield accounting software.

Twinfield implements OpenID Connect for identity verification and OAuth 2.0 for token-based authentication. Register your application at the Twinfield developer portal (https://developers.twinfield.com) to obtain a Client ID and optional Client Secret.

Supported flows:
- **Authorization Code** -- for applications with a server-side backend (recommended). Requires client secret. Supports refresh tokens via the `offline_access` scope.
- **Implicit** -- for native and JavaScript-based clients. No client secret required.

After obtaining an access token, call the `accesstokenvalidation` endpoint to retrieve the `twf.clusterUrl` claim, which identifies the cluster URL for subsequent SOAP/API calls (e.g., `https://api.<cluster>.twinfield.com`).

Token lifetimes:
- Implicit flow access token: 43,200 seconds (12 hours)
- Authorization code: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- Authorization code access token: 3,600 seconds (1 hour)
- Refresh token: 788,940,000 seconds (25 years)

get.description:
Initiates the OAuth 2.0 authorization flow. For the authorization code flow, set `response_type=code`. For the implicit flow, set `response_type=id_token+token`.

The user is redirected to the Twinfield login screen. After authentication and consent, the browser redirects to `redirect_uri` with either an authorization code (code flow) or tokens in the URL fragment (implicit flow).

The `twf.organisationUser` scope is mandatory for login.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The Client ID obtained from the Twinfield developer portal.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The registered redirect URI for your application.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The desired response type. Use `code` for authorization code flow or `id_token token` for implicit flow.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Space-delimited list of scopes. Must include `openid` and `twf.organisationUser`. Add `offline_access` for refresh tokens (code flow only).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: An opaque value used to maintain state between the request and callback. Used for CSRF protection.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random string used to associate the client session with the ID token and to mitigate replay attacks.

302.description:
Redirect to Twinfield login screen. After authentication, redirects to `redirect_uri` with either:
- **Code flow**: `?code=<authorization_code>&state=<state>&session_state=<session_state>`
- **Implicit flow**: `#id_token=<id_token>&access_token=<access_token>&token_type=Bearer&expires_in=<seconds>&scope=<scopes>&state=<state>&session_state=<session_state>`

400.description: Invalid request parameters (e.g., unknown client_id, invalid redirect_uri)

post.description:
Exchanges an authorization code for tokens, or refreshes an expired access token using a refresh token.

Uses HTTP Basic authentication with your Client ID and Client Secret encoded as `Base64(<client_id>:<client_secret>)` in the Authorization header.

**Authorization code exchange**: Set `grant_type=authorization_code`, provide `code` and `redirect_uri`.
**Token refresh**: Set `grant_type=refresh_token`, provide `refresh_token`.

Token lifetimes:
- Access token: 3,600 seconds (1 hour)
- Refresh token: 788,940,000 seconds (25 years)

grant_type.description: The grant type. Use `authorization_code` to exchange a code, or `refresh_token` to refresh.

code.description: The authorization code received from the authorize endpoint. Required when `grant_type=authorization_code`.

redirect_uri.description: Must match the redirect_uri used in the authorize request. Required when `grant_type=authorization_code`.

200.description: Token response. When using `authorization_code` grant, includes `id_token`, `access_token`, and optionally `refresh_token`. When refreshing, returns a new `access_token` and `refresh_token`.

400.description: Token request failed. See error codes in the response body.

get.summary: Validate access token and discover cluster
get.description: Validates an access token and returns its claims. The response includes `twf.clusterUrl`, which is the base URL for the Twinfield API cluster (e.g., `https://api.<cluster>.twinfield.com`). You must use this cluster URL for all subsequent SOAP/API web service calls.

200.description: Token is valid. Returns claims including the cluster URL.

get.description:
Standard OpenID Connect UserInfo endpoint. Returns identity claims about the authenticated user based on the scopes granted during authorization.

Requires a valid access token in the Authorization header.

200.description: User identity claims based on the granted scopes.

401.description: Unauthorized -- invalid or expired access token.

twinfield_oidc.description: OpenID Connect / OAuth 2.0 authentication for Twinfield. Register your application at the Twinfield developer portal to obtain a Client ID and Client Secret. The `twf.organisationUser` scope is mandatory for login. Add `offline_access` to enable refresh tokens.

scopes.twf.user: Twinfield user identity: twf.id (user GUID), twf.organisationUserCode, twf.organisationId
scopes.twf.organisationUser: Organisation user info: twf.organisationUserCode, twf.organisationCode, twf.organisationId (mandatory for login)
scopes.offline_access: Enables refresh tokens for long-lived access

scopes.twf.user: Twinfield user identity: twf.id (user GUID), twf.organisationUserCode, twf.organisationId
scopes.twf.organisationUser: Organisation user info: twf.organisationUserCode, twf.organisationCode, twf.organisationId (mandatory for login)

TokenResponse.description: Successful token response from the token endpoint

id_token.description: JWT containing identity claims. Present when exchanging an authorization code (not on refresh).

access_token.description: Bearer access token for authenticating API requests. Valid for 3,600 seconds (1 hour) in authorization code flow, or 43,200 seconds (12 hours) in implicit flow.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens. Only present if `offline_access` scope was requested. Valid for 788,940,000 seconds (approximately 25 years).

TokenErrorResponse.description: Error response from the token endpoint

error.description: Error code indicating the type of failure.

TokenValidationResponse.description: Claims returned when validating an access token. The `twf.clusterUrl` claim is essential for determining which cluster to send API requests to.

twf.clusterUrl.description: Base URL of the Twinfield API cluster for this user's organisation (e.g., `https://api.accounting.twinfield.com`). Use this URL for all subsequent web service calls.

twf.id.description: GUID of the Twinfield ID (if available).

sub.description: Subject identifier for the authenticated user.

scope.description: Space-delimited list of scopes granted to the token.

aud.description: Audience the token was issued for (Client ID).

UserInfoResponse.description: OpenID Connect UserInfo response. Claims returned depend on the scopes granted during authorization.

sub.description: Subject identifier for the authenticated user.

twf.id.description: GUID of the Twinfield ID. Requires `twf.user` scope.

twf.organisationUserCode.description: User code within the organisation. Requires `twf.user` or `twf.organisationUser` scope.

twf.organisationId.description: GUID of the organisation. Requires `twf.user`, `twf.organisation`, or `twf.organisationUser` scope.

twf.organisationCode.description: Code of the organisation. Requires `twf.organisation` or `twf.organisationUser` scope.

twf.clusterUrl.description: URL of the cluster on which the organisation is located. Requires `twf.organisation` scope.
